DOC.brief_title: Effects Electrical Stimulation Blood Circulation Sensibility Tactil Lymphadenectomy
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : surgical treatment breast cancer , especially axillary lymphadenectomy ( AL ) , cause blood circulatory change , also partial total lesion sensory nerve intercostobrachial , often cause anesthesia hypoesthesia correspond dermatome ipsilateral upper limb surgery . Objective : investigate influence high voltage electrical stimulation ( HVES ) blood flow tactile sensitivity nerve path intercostobrachial woman undergo AL . Methodology : sample 30 volunteer , age 40 60 year , divide two equal group ( n = 15 ) : woman axillary dissection breast cancer undergo therapeutic procedure ( GAL ) control group ( CG ) compose woman undergo axillary surgery . The treatment procedure consist application high voltage electrical simulation 30 minute limbs twice week course seven week . The profile blood flow , include speed , direction evaluate mean continuous wave Doppler ultrasound . The assessment tactile sensitivity accomplish esthesiometer three stage : start first therapeutic procedure , completion intervention 30 day end treatment ( wash-out ) . The data analyze use descriptive statistic ( ANOVA ) even hypothesis test Shapiro-Wilk data normally distribute , non-parametric test use . For analysis use SPSS software critical level 5 % . The result obtain study aim justify therapy intervention equipment treatment morbidity cause axillary linfadenectomy .
DOC.criteria: woman , 40 60 year old , abnormal sensitivity ipsilateral upper limb due Type Madden Modified Radical Mastectomy breast cancer axillary lymphadenectomy patient undergo type surgery consider inclusion criterion , bilateral mastectomy , diagnosis metastasis , skin disorder ulcer erysipelas region ( nearby ) intercostal nerve pathway . We also exclude volunteer sort cognitive impairment
